org.sd.util
Class MappedString

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.util.MappedString

public class MappedString
extends java.lang.Object

A container class for referencing an original string from its mapped or transformed version.

Author:
Spence Koehler

getOriginalIndex

public int[] getOriginalIndex(int mappedIndex)
Get the start index and length in the original string of the character at the given index in the mapped string.

NOTE: This method will return null for non-existent positions, including the length of the string.

Parameters:
mappedIndex - The index of a character in the mapped string.
Returns:
the start index in result[0] and the length in the original string of the character at the given index in the mapped string or null if out of range.

convertIndex

public int convertIndex(int mappedIndex)
Convert the mapped index to an original index.

NOTE: This method properly maps the end of the strings to each other.

Parameters:
mappedIndex - An index in the mapped string.
Returns:
the original index or -1 if out of range.

originalSubstring

public java.lang.String originalSubstring(int mappedStart,
                                          int mappedEnd)
Get the original substring corresponding to the mapped indexes.

Parameters:
mappedStart - The mapped start index (inclusive).
mappedEnd - The mapped end index (exclusive).
Returns:
the corresponding original substring.
